title: Google SheetsCOUNTBLANK Function

metadata.description: Learn about Google SheetsCOUNTBLANK Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Google Sheets
COUNTBLANK Function

COUNTBLANK Function
The
COUNTBLANK
function is a premade function in Google Sheets
content_sections.content: , which counts blank cells in a range.

content_sections.title: It is typed
content_sections.content:
=COUNTBLANK
and gets a list of cells:
=COUNTBLANK(
value1
,
[value2, ...]
)
You can
select cells one by one, but also ranges, or even multiple ranges.
Note:
The
COUNTBLANK
function is helpful to find empty cells in a range.

content_sections.title: Apply the
content_sections.content:
=COUNTBLANK
function to range
C2:C21
, to find the Pokemons which do not have a 2nd Type:
Name	Type 1	Type 2	Total stats
    Mankey	Fighting		305
    Poliwrath	Water	Fighting	510
    Victreebel	Grass	Poison	490
    Tentacool	Water	Poison	335
    Magneton	Electric	Steel	465
    Dewgong	Water	Ice	475
    Cloyster	Water	Ice	525
    Onix	Rock	Ground	385
    Dragonair	Dragon		420
    Pidgeotto	Normal	Flying	349
    Rattata	Normal		253
    Beedrill	Bug	Poison	395
    Doduo	Normal	Flying	310
    Kingler	Water		475
    Nidoqueen	Poison	Ground	505
    Hitmonchan	Fighting		455
    Charmeleon	Fire		405
    Arbok	Poison		438
    Gastly	Ghost	Poison	310
    Magikarp	Water		200
Copy Values
COUNTBLANK
function, step by step:
Select the cell
C22

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=COUNTBLANK
Click the
COUNTBLANK
command
Specify range
C2:C21
Hit enter
The
COUNTBLANK
function successfully counted
8
blank cells in the range
C2:C21
.

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers Google SheetsCOUNTBLANK Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Google SheetsCOUNTBLANK Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Google SheetsCOUNTBLANK Function and how to apply it in your projects.
